Author: Cryptofist#7504
Content: When you're running the daemon you follow most of the commands in the guide, just remove ''./"

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Oh yes, actually just usage of `.\` instead of `./` should make a trick
@andrew
Start ROGUE daemon in one cmd terminal, then In other terminal:
```.\komodo-cli -ac_name=ROGUE getaccountaddress ""
.\komodo-cli -ac_name=ROGUE validateaddress address^^
You'll get a `pubkey:` on this stage
.\komodo-cli -ac_name=ROGUE stop
```
Then restart ROGUE daemon with `-pubkey=pubkey_which_you_get_from_validateaddress` param

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
`TonyLToday at 4:38 AM`
...update komodod daemon (at first stop it by```./komodo-cli -ac_name=ROGUE stop```):
```cd ~/komodo
git checkout jl777
git pull
make clean
cd src
rm komodod komodo-cli komodo-tx *.so
cd cc
rm *.so
cd ../..
./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc) ```
 for Mac it will be:
```cd ~/komodo
git checkout jl777
git pull
make clean
cd src
rm komodod komodo-cli komodo-tx *.dylib
cd cc
rm *.dylib
cd ../..
./zcutil/build-mac.sh```

Content:
`TonyLToday at 9:36 AM`
```Published testing nightly Ubuntu and OSX ROGUE bundles (daemon + rogue + TUI): 
https://github.com/tonymorony/komodo_cryptoconditions_tui/releases/tag/0.1n```
`Windows is coming`
```In next version will update TUI to do these steps automatically: 

Start ROGUE chain, get valid for wallet pubkey, stop the daemon
Copy ROGUE.conf to the folder with unzipped files
Start the daemon with valid pubkey
Wait for chain synchronization```

Author: Cryptofist#7504
Content: @kmdkrazy  Ive been trying to think on how to answer your question. The money part I can not answer at all. As far as a GUI, someone will have to know how to work with ``C`` code and build from there, the game uses an engine called ``curses`` to create the current game interface.  There would also be some learning on the fly with the blockchain side of things as far as I know... JL777  can assist the GUI devs for ROGUE where *needed* (as well for new games to be put  on chain...)   There will be a GUI contest at some point soon for people to create one for our Crypto Rogue.....  a head start on that might pay off well.
